properties.query:
//Contributor: Jeremy Kesterson
//Reference:  https://expel.io/blog/following-cloudtrail-generating-aws-security-signals-sumo-logic/  
//Reviewer: Lucas Trainer
//Changelog: 7/19/2023 excluded aws_security_sbx to allow for testing 
//Description: Detects when logging is stopped or deleted for cloudtrail. This could be used for defense evasion and is considered very infrequent and suspicious.
//Handling guidance: Reach out to the associated user / team (if applicable) and find their use-case. Confirm with secops that this is authorized and expected.
AWSCloudTrail
| where dynamic(['DeleteTrail', 'DisableLogging', 'StopLogging']) has EventName
| join kind=inner _GetWatchlist('aws-accounts') on $left.UserIdentityAccountId == $right.accountid
| extend AccountName = name
| where AccountName != "aws_security_sbx"
| extend LogName = parse_json(RequestParameters).name
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    AccountName,
    EventSource,
    EventName,
    UserIdentityArn,
    UserIdentityAccountId,
    SessionIssuerUserName,
    SessionIssuerArn,
    LogName,
    ErrorCode,
    ErrorMessage,
    RequestParameters

alertDetailsOverride.alertDisplayNameFormat: AWS CloudTrail - {{AccountName}}: Logging Disabled / Stopped (Defense Evasion)
alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat:
Analytic rule detects when logging is stopped or deleted either for cloudtrail or netflows. Disabling logging could be used for defense evasion and is considered very infrequent / suspicious. Key Fields:
Environment: {{AccountName}}
Action: {{RequestParameters}}
Actor: {{UserIdentityArn}}
Handling guidance: Reach out to the associated user / team (if applicable) and find their use-case. Confirm with secops that this is authorized and expected. False postives may occur where the Environment ends with _tst or _dev, and a team is deleting resources
